snippet: The university’s warnings to students as a mass shooting began in 2007 were not negligent, the state’s Supreme Court ruled Thursday.
abstract: Virginia Supreme Court rules that Virginia Tech's warnings to students as 2007 mass shooting by Seung-Hui Cho began were not negligent, thwarting wrongful-death lawsuit brought on behalf of Julia Pryde and Erin Peterson, two students who were killed.
lead_paragraph: The university’s warnings to students as a mass shooting began in 2007 were not negligent, the state’s Supreme Court ruled Thursday.

headline.main: Virginia Tech Held Not Negligent in ’07 Killings
headline.print_headline: University Held Not Negligent In ‘07 Killings

keywords.value: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
